name: Alex Melching
description: MCSE - A Microsoft Azure and Office 365 Enthusiast. Sr. Technical Specialist at TechHouse consulting and supporting SMBs utilizing Microsoft Public Cloud Services such as Office 365 (Exchange Online, SharePoint Online), Dynamics CRM Online, Microsoft Intune, and Microsoft Azure.

name: James Buckner
description: Jim Buckner has been in IT education at the corporate and college levels for the past nineteen years. After earning his Microsoft MCSE and MCT certifications Jim began teaching Microsoft Certification courses. Jim is currently employed at New Horizons Computer Learning Center in Jacksonville FL where he is responsible for teaching several CompTIA courses, and also teaches Certified Ethical Hacking, and CISSP Security courses. He has earned his CompTIA A+, Network+, and Security+, Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) and Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) certifications. Jim earned a BBA degree with a Major in Finance from Georgia Southern University and a Masters Degree in Network Security from Capitol College in Laurel MD. Jim was recently recognized by CompTIA as one of the top 3 instructors in the country, and for each of the past 5 years he has been ranked in the top 1% of all New Horizons instructors worldwide.

name: Adnan Cartwright
description: Adnan Cartwright has worked with different companies to help secure, expand, and maintain their networks using the most update technology available. Awarded the Microsoft Most Valuable Professional award in Software Packaging, Deployment and Servicing. Adnan has presented numerous events including the launch of Server 2012 and Windows 8. A graduate from ITT Technical Institute earning degrees in Information Technology Computer Networking Systems and Information Systems Security. Adnan is involved within the technical community and has a passion for teaching and sharing technical knowledge to both young adults and current professionals in the field today. As one of the organizers of the IT PRO Camp and volunteer for the I Center Community Foundation which teaches at risk kids IT skills. Adnan is immersed in the betterment of people. Founder of the Florida IT Server Group which is located both in South Florida and Jacksonville Florida. Adnan's passion for bettering those who come into contact still continues to this day.

name: Blain Barton
description: Raised in Spokane Washington, Blain Barton has been with Microsoft for over 20 years and has held many diverse positions. His career started in 1988 as Team Leader in Manufacturing and Distribution, progressed to PSS Team Manager for Visual Basic Product Support, Product Consultant for Microsoft Word Division, OEM Systems Engineer and currently serves as a Senior IT Pro Evangelist. Blain has organized and delivered a wide array of technical events and has presented over 1000 live events and has received over six “top-presenter” speaking awards. He has traveled the world 3 times delivering OEM training sessions on pre-installing Microsoft Windows on new PC’s. He attended Washington State University graduating with a Bachelor’s Degree in English/Business and Minor in Computer Science. After college, Blain taught snow skiing on a professional level in the Cascade Mountains before starting his career with Microsoft. For a hobby, Blain runs a 10-acre palm tree silviculture operation in Homosassa Florida.

name: Hector Cisneros
description: Hector Cisneros is COO and director of Social Media Marketing at Working the Web to Win, an award-winning Internet marketing company based in Jacksonville, Florida.  He is also co-host of the weekly Internet radio show, "Working the Web to Win" on BlogTalkRadio.com, which airs every Tuesday at 4 p.m. Eastern. Hector is a syndicated writer and published author of “60 Seconds to Success and co-author of Working the Web to Win.”

name: Larry Gurule
description: Larry is the President of i-infusion, Inc and Chairperson, Florida Section SAE International. He has Decades of Configuration Management experience on hundreds of government and commercial projects including the DoD, tier 1 and sub tier aerospace/defense suppliers, electronic developers/manufactures, medical developers/manufactures, automotive developers/manufactures, and industrial equipment developers/manufactures, as well as numerous service/process industry technology implementations. Experienced consultant and CM instructor specializing in the methodical investigation, analysis, review and documentation of all or part of a business in terms of business functions and processes, the information used and the data on which the information is based. For use in process and knowledge driven environments, including acquisition, product development, engineering, manufacturing, supply chain, retail, distribution, and sustainment.

name: Scott Gleason
description: Scott is a DBA here in Jacksonville for over the last ten years. He is also Vice President of the Jacksonville SQL Server Users Group.

name: Bayer White
description: Bayer White is a .NET Architect and Microsoft Integration, Microsoft MVP and co-founder of Jacksonville's Microsoft Developers User Group (MDUGJax). He is known within the Florida developer community from speaking at Florida Code Camps, blogging and writing articles. He has also spoken at various conferences such as PASS, DevConnections and VSLive and has been invited to Microsoft’s campus to attend Software Design Reviews (SDR) for future products. His blog can be found at http://www.humanworkflow.net and his Twitter tag is BayerWhite. Check out his latest book, published in December 2012 by Apress titled, Pro WF4.5.

name: David McKay
description: A diverse Database Professional covering all areas ranging from performance tuning on VLDB's to Reporting. Certified administrator for SQL Server 2000, 2005 and 2008R2 and hands on experience in Developing and Managing the Microsoft BI Stack (SSRS, SSIS, SSMS and SharePoint) environments in a Relational Database environment. Manage over 100 SQL Servers in this environment maintaining 100% up time and availability to over 50 Tier 1 applications to over 1000 employees. Specialties include capacity planning, data conversion, data analysis, ETL, database administration, disaster recovery planning, data optimization, process engineering, programming, quality control, relational databases, Reporting, SDLC, SQL Server 2005,2008R2, systems analysis, T-SQL, Stored Procedures.

name: Joey Van Do
description: Joey is an UNF alumnus with a BS in Computer Science. Joey has over 30 yrs of computing/hacking experience: Banking, Insurance, Consulting, and Military (hardware, servers, and networks). Since May 1st, 2014, Joey has officially retired with over 25 yrs of service combined from the Navy, Army, and Air National Guard. He is currently serving VyStar Credit Union members as a Senior IT Auditor.

name: Mark Radacz
description: #HusbandFatherLife-L­­ongMateGeek.. 20 years hands-on experience in object oriented software analysis, design and development. X-Platform enterprise mobile apps dev using Xamarin tools co-founder of www.NFLXUG.com and www.MDUGJax.com currently works as Senior Consultant at Agile Thought.

name: Matthew Smith
description: Matthew Smith, an IT Analyst, Security Enthusiast and Hobbyist with seven years in the IT Field. Currently a TEKsystems contractor for Bank of America in the area of Data Storage. Well rounded experience in all platforms and applications.

name: Steven Wheeler
description: Steven Wheeler is the Client Services Supervisor for a software development company, System Innovators. He is also the company’s one man IT shop until it gets migrated to Harris Computer’s domain. Steven’s technical background includes 16 years of component level electronics repair along with 6 years of line-of-sight microwave communications, networking, and encryption. Steven has also been working in computer networking since 1997 and obtained Microsoft’s legacy networking certification (MCSE) in 1999. He has great experience with computer LAN management, Systems Administrator, and computer repair as well as printer, scanner, and other small device service and repair. Steven grew up loving sailing, woodworking, and photography.

name: Ed Wilson
description: Ed Wilson is the Microsoft Scripting Guy, and writes the daily Hey Scripting Guy blog. He is the co-founder of PowerShell Saturday, and the Charlotte PowerShell User Group. He is a frequent speaker at conferences, user groups and other places where groups of computer people may be found. He has written books about every version of Windows PowerShell, as well as other books related to automation and operating systems. His most recent book is Windows PowerShell Best Practices.

name: Jyoti Chawla
description: Jyoti Chawla is a  Senoir Software Engineer with 30 years of experience in IT. Jyoti is the organinzer for the Jax Architecture Signature Group. He is also a registered nurse.

name: Devin Knight
description: Devin is a Senior BI consultant at Pragmatic Works Consulting.  Previously, he tech edited the book Professional Microsoft SQL Server 2008 Integration Services and was an author in the books Knight’s 24-Hour Trainer: Microsoft SQL Server 2008 Integration Services, Knight’s Microsoft Business Intelligence 24-Hour Trainer and SharePoint 2010 Business Intelligence 24-Hour Trainer.  He has spoken at past conferences like PASS, SQL Saturdays and Code Camps. He is also the Vice President of the local SQL users’ group (JSSUG).

name: Bill Crowe
description: Bill Crowe is a Vice President with JP Morgan Chase. Bill has over 20 years experience in Information Security Management, Risk Management, Third Party Oversight and Integrated Auditing performing those functions in the U. S. Navy, the private sector and 2 global financial institutions.  Bill is an experienced speaker, presenting security, vendor management and audit topics in such forums as the 2014 Governance Risk and Controls Conference, 2013 ISACA Chapter Leadership, 2011-2013 University of North Florida CyberSecurity forums and various professional organizations in Jacksonville. Bill is an Adjunct Professor with ITT-Tech with over 5 years teaching in the Bachelor of Science degree program for Information Systems CyberSecurity. Bill has his  BS in Business Management and MBA. Bills certifications with ISACA are the Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA),Certified Information Systems Manager (CISM) and Certified in Risk and  Information Systems Controls (CRISC). Bill is also Certified in Risk Management Assurance from the IIA.  Bill is the Chapter President for the ISACA Jacksonville Chapter.

name: Rahul Ravindran
description: Rahul Ravindran works as a technology solution strategist helping clients design, architect and develop custom tailored applications. He is an experienced architect in delivering highly scalable and distributed application systems spanning Microsoft and open source technologies. Rahul is a V-TSP (Virtual Technology Solutions Professional) with Microsoft focused on SharePoint, Business Intelligence and Azure. Rahul conducts monthly webinars on SharePoint and Azure and also speaks at Microsoft events on Cloud Computing, Business Intelligence and Big Data.

name: Paul Fogel
description: Paul is the Division Director for Robert Half Technology. With more than 5 years of experience specializing in the placement of highly skilled IT and Engineering professionals with a wide variety of companies.
